column5: Just met with my fishing buddy tonight, planning on fishing Lake Temagami this spring.( 1st week of June.)  I know it's a big intimidating lake, so I need as much advice as I can get from all you Lake Temagami experts. We will be staying in the hub. I've researched a few spots. Rabbitnose island, high rock island. What about Ferguson bay ? It's a long way on the map, is it worth our time ? Any other advice would be appreciated.  4.5 months and counting can't wait.  thanks.
blackflys will probally be in full attack bring head net and fly dope.
There are NO fish in Lake Temagami!

A portable sonar unit would be a great help in locating underwater structure and depth. This will help you locate the fish.  Sorry I have minimal experience in this area but thats the best advice I can give you.
you might nned a scuba diver to help u , iam for rent
